meanings.sent1: After eating a surfeit of candy, the child felt sick.
meanings.sent2: The surfeit of toys in the room made it difficult to walk around.
meanings.sent3: The surfeit of balloons at the party popped one by one, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her surfeit of jewelry overflowed from the small box, sparkling in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The surfeit of stars in the night sky took her breath away.

meanings.definition: To indulge in something to excess
meanings.sent1: He would often surfeit on ice cream, eating multiple bowls in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: She tends to surfeit on shopping during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The cat would surfeit on catnip, rolling around in pure delight.
meanings.sent4: His mind would surfeit on worries, unable to find peace.
meanings.sent5: The child would surfeit on laughter, giggling uncontrollably at every joke.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to desire no more of something
meanings.sent1: The bitter taste of the medicine would surfeit her from taking it again.
meanings.sent2: The constant rain surfeited him of outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The surfeited audience left the theater early, uninterested in the play.
meanings.sent4: The surfeited traveler longed for the simplicity of home.
meanings.sent5: The surfeited student dreaded the thought of studying any longer.
